I wonder if <b>html</b> is a bad idea?

-------[1466214760 / 2016-06-17 21:52:40]-------

-------[1466214966 / 2016-06-17 21:56:06]-------

-------[1466215108 / 2016-06-17 21:58:28]-------

-------[1466215211 / 2016-06-17 22:00:11]-------
compare version numbers by int(version) rather than comparing strings (duh!)
require a check version at the start to catch a new install.
launch the right folder after update, and alert the user the move files.

-------[1466265987 / 2016-06-18 12:06:27]-------
gave the updater capability to read command line arguments
made 'swhlab-distribute.bat' file

-------[1466266542 / 2016-06-18 12:15:42]-------
added IV functionality to swhlab (and tests)
added percentage functionality (compared to averaging) as a way to get averages of IV curves in voltage clamp while disregarding IPSCs.
improved test routine execution report (bar graph of execution time)

-------[1466293634 / 2016-06-18 19:47:14]-------
made event detection (at least for APs)
threshold may include derivative
made tons new functions for plotting events in the test suite
made universal colormap assignment possible

-------[1466311970 / 2016-06-19 00:52:50]-------

-------[1466356620 / 2016-06-19 13:17:00]-------
improved protocol detection. Figured out it depends on nSam and nADC
fixed memtest issues which made it crash when epoch0 was different than holding current

-------[1466395925 / 2016-06-20 00:12:05]-------

the update script now COMPLETELY wipes the swhlab folder and replaces it.
it's best if you don't run it from within spyder, or version.py doesn't seem to update.
interestingly, I don't think origin "locks" this file.
